intro: Rosa alpina var. ovoidea, commonly known as the Alpine rose or the oval-leafed rock rose, is a perennial shrub native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense, thornless stems. The plant produces fragrant, single or double pink to white flowers in early summer. Its leaves are oval-shaped, glossy, and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
